alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit; Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 08 at 3:16PM HST until February 10 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING OVER AND DOWNWIND OF THE KOHALA MOUNTAINS OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...WIND ADVISORY FOR MOST LOWER ELEVATIONS OF THE STATE... ...WIND ADVISORY FOR THE SUMMITS OF MAUNA KEA MAUNA LOA AND HALEAKALA STARTING THIS EVENING... .Strong high pressure north of the state will drift slowly eastward through Friday. The high will drive strong and gusty trade winds that will be accelerated over and downwind of island terrain. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...East winds 35 to 55 mph with localized gusts over 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit on Maui and the Summits of Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa on the Big Island. * WHEN...From 6 PM today to 6 PM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking difficult. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Consider postponing travel to the summits until conditions improve. If you must travel to the summits, use extra caution walking and driving. Be careful opening or closing doors.
